name: Chien-Shiung Wu
quote: There is only one thing worse than coming home from the lab to a sink full of dirty dishes, and that is not going to the lab at all!
summary: Chinese-American physicist known as the 'First Lady of Physics' for her groundbreaking work in nuclear physics and the Manhattan Project.
shortDescription: Chien-Shiung Wu was a Chinese-American physicist known as the 'First Lady of Physics.' She made groundbreaking contributions to nuclear physics, including the famous Wu experiment, and worked on the Manhattan Project.

detailed_description.early_life: Born in Jiangsu, China, Chien-Shiung was encouraged by her father to pursue education. She studied physics at National Central University and later earned her PhD at UC Berkeley.
detailed_description.stem_journey: Wu moved to the US for graduate studies and became a leading experimental physicist. She worked on the Manhattan Project and later conducted the Wu experiment, which disproved the law of parity conservation.
detailed_description.challenges: As a Chinese woman in physics, Wu faced racial and gender discrimination throughout her career.
detailed_description.achievements: Conducted the Wu experiment, worked on the Manhattan Project, and became the first female president of the American Physical Society.
detailed_description.legacy: Wu's work changed the field of physics and paved the way for women and minorities in science.
